# value

**Instance Property**

The slider’s current value.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var value: Float { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to get and set the slider’s current value. To render an animated transition from the current value to the new value, use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISlider/setValue(_:animated:)] method instead.

If you try to set a value that’s below the minimum or above the maximum, the minimum or maximum value is set instead. The default value of this property is `0.0`.

## Accessing the slider’s value

- **setValue(_:animated:)**: Sets the slider’s current value, allowing you to animate the change visually.
